resp.text: Thanks for highlighting how our location plays into the area surrounding us, Jack. Downtown living definitely comes at a price but we do our best to keep it affordable! We're glad you're enjoying your time with us so far, man.

name: Nour Kamar
text: Amazing staff and amenities!!

resp.text: Amazing residents and reviews, too! ;)

name: Breck B
text: The West and Wright apartments themselves are so cute and elegant, and they look just like the model that you tour. With other apartment places around auburn, I’ve seen apartments that are horrendously ugly and in terrible condition, nothing like the model. This also has an optimal location, view, and lighting. The granite countertops make cooking SO much easier. The staff is so friendly and always willing to help, efficient with packages, and with putting in work orders. The only complaint I have is that sometimes certain outlets of ours go out but resetting them with the fuse box typically works.

resp.text: Thanks for this truly amazing review, Breck! The model is definitely what we hope to provide for every resident who joins our community. Thanks for detailing what you love about your unit!

name: Emma Robinson
text: I love living at West and Wright. I have a great view of the stadium and of Samford hall from my living room window. The location is perfect for walking to class, and going out downtown to bars, dinner, and shopping. The prices are the lowest in the area, and the amenities are great!

resp.text: All in all, exactly what we hope for every resident here at W&W! Thank you for this beautiful review, Emma!

name: Emily Jenkins
text: Great amenities and location

resp.text: We're of the same mindset, Emily! Thanks for your comments.

name: Kendi Davis
text: I lived in West & Wright for the 2019-2020 school term and I would not recommend this apartment to another Auburn student. The apartment common areas were not well maintained, and the garbage chute was backed up on the weekends. I could never seem to talk to management unless I went to the office directly and maintenance request always took a while to get a response.

resp.text: We're super thankful for your feedback regarding your '19-'20 term at West & Wright, Kendi. The communication and lack of response to your concerns is below our typical standard at W&W and we want to apologize firstly for this. We haven't had any recent issues with the garbage chutes or general common areas being cluttered, but understand there could have been times in the past where this was an issue for you. If there is a situation like this for any current or incoming residents, we encourage direct and immediate communication so that we can properly attend to it. Thank you again for your feedback, Kendi; we hope your future post-W&W has been magnificent!

name: Burke Eaton
text: Great place, location is ideal!!

resp.text: Love to see you enjoying the W&W complex and all that surrounds it, Burke!

name: Jean Caroline Moffitt
text: I like West and Wright because it is close to everything. I have quick access to the downtown shops and I can walk to class easily. It is like living on campus but better! I renewed and can’t wait for another year. Also, West and Wright has great parking and has lots of fun activities and perks for its residents. LOVE!

resp.text: Thanks so much, Jean! Happy we could provide a five-star experience for you.

name: Isabel Barganier
text: West and Wright is a fantastic place to live and I definitely suggest disregarding the ridiculously negative reviews! The staff is so sweet and they are constantly doing fun things for the residents. I use the fitness center almost daily and love it, it's such a blessing to have a full gym a few floors below me! The location is truly UNBEATABLE, it's awesome to have such a short walk to class. I really appreciate the parking deck (keeping my car cool in the heat and it's comforting to know my car is protected!) I have thoroughly enjoyed my apartment and look forward to living here next year too!

resp.text: Appreciate the great rating, Isabel! Let us know if there is anything else we can provide for you. :)

name: Ashley Barganier
text: We have been very happy with our daughter’s experience at West and Wright. The apartment building is clean and inviting. There are always activities going on to make it feel like a community. The amenities are really nice and the location can’t be beat. Above all else we feel like it is a very safe place for her to live. She easily walks to classes and local restaurants. We definitely recommend these apartments as a great choice for your student.

resp.text: Thank you for the review of your daughter's and your experience with our complex and amenities, Ashley. It's so important that parents feel comfortable with the living situation, and we thrive on this feedback!

name: Henry Hooner
text: Wonderful location, BUT not without many other issues. For one, they have started locking the front doors at ALL times. It is impossible for a guest to enter the building without having to go downstairs and let them in. Elevators don’t have any visible certificate of operation. Hallways are often left dirty. Construction on the building has been going on forever and shows no signs of stopping soon. The actual units themselves are very nice though.

resp.text: West & Wright appreciates your feedback, Henry. Thank you for voicing your concerns about the security and construction around our complex. Our doors were always meant to operate in the fashion they now do; if you'd like us to explain the process for using the keypads to allow visitors in, come by and we'll gladly show you. We've also sent out weekly updates about the construction status to invite questions or concerns from residents. If there is anything directly we can do to help you understand the building schedule, we ask that you give us a call this week. Thank you, Henry!

name: Madeline Williams
text: The apartment is in a great location.  With the location comes with some noise, but worth it for the quick trips to class and downtown on the weekends.  Rooms are also a bit small due to the location, but the quality of the rooms are great.  It's one of the newer apartment complexes in Auburn so the appliances are modern, the bathrooms (showers) are gorgeous and it's fully furnished which makes move in a million times easier.  Haven't had to make many maintenance requests and whenever we do, they are answered quickly. The maintenance men are the nicest staff at West & Wright!!! Management has changed while I've lived here and the transition was a little rough because the new staff was not as friendly, but I think they are working on it because the two newer employees are very pleasant and helpful.   Also prices have dropped  significantly so if you are budget conscious this is definitely a great place to check out!

resp.text: Thank you so much for a great write-up, Madeline! We're definitely listening to the feedback we've heard in regards to staff and pricing, and we hope that the changes continue to excite new and current residents. Thanks for choosing West & Wright!

name: Will Collins
text: West and Wright is an amazing apartment to live in. Not only is the location amazing, but the staff is very friendly and helpful. The maintenance team is very fast acting and very friendly aswell.  The community pool, weight room, and clubhouse are just another benefit to living here. Prices are reasonable for the location, covered parking, and its premium apartment layouts and design.

resp.text: Thank you for the wonderful comments, Will. Always nice to see the amenities being put to good use. We love seeing you around, too!

name: Emma Herbe
text: Convenient place to live in Auburn.

resp.text: The convenience is a huge win here! Thanks for the comment, Emma.

name: Hayley D.
text: Great location and amenities!

resp.text: Glad you feel this way, Hayley! Thank you for your special review. :)

name: Prashanth M
text:
I had a really bad experience living here. I lived in a 5B5B and it made me feel miserable. Your room feels more like a jail cell. Its tiny and there's no room for any of your stuff. There's construction going on from early in the morning and if that doesn't wake you up, there's the train. To top it off, one of my roommates was an outright racist, used the N word several times a day in a degrading manner. I felt extremely uncomfortable to live in my apartment as a person of color. Cops rushed into my apartment to arrest the guy for reasons I'm still not aware of. I think some background checks would definitely help.

Financially, this place was an absolute disaster for me. Firstly, the units are grossly overpriced. Secondly, they charge $18 for any online method to pay rent including e checks which is preposterous. It feels like exploitation of the customer knowing well that people don't use paper checks in this digital age we live in. In the last year, I've paid over $200 in "convenience fees". I've personally never seen any institution charge fees for e checks in my life. Plus, there's no way to break your lease. And most people who would wanna sub lease would be put off by the price or the no pet policy. I ended up paying some $4500 without living there for the last few months. A lease break by paying 2 or 3 months' rent would've been a huge relief.

name: Angie Feemster
text: There’s 2.8 stars for a reason. Do your research. Don’t move into a place just because it’s pretty and has pretty amenities.

resp.text: Hey Angie, we understand how you may feel about our reviews and property in accordance. We invite you and any other Google readers to give us a call directly to discuss any concerns you may have as provided in the reviews online. Our general manager Amy can be reached at 334-826-1202 at any time during office hours. Thank you for your comments.

name: Maddie Luther
text: This is my first year living at West and Wright, it has been the best place I have lived. It is the best location you can ask for and has great amenities. I love my apartment. There are a couple things that need changing (wifi and parking) but everywhere does. The staff is helpful. Glad that I resigned and now I get to see how much better it will get next year!!! The #wright place to live !

resp.text: We're so glad you renewed too, Maddie! Thank you for being an incredible resident and always engaging with our team whenever you need anything. Happy to have you with us!

name: Meagan Kingren
text: Great location! Love how close to campus it is. Kitchen is great for someone who loves to cook. Little pricey, but for the location and amenities, it is worth it!

resp.text: We're so delighted to see you feel it's all worth it, Meagan. Thank you for the amazing and insightful review!

name: Madison Schoeberl
text: I have lived at West and Wright for two years and I love it. The location is amazing for walking to class and downtown. The new staff is really great and always seem to be available. I especially love the community events they host!

resp.text: We've loved having you for those two years, Madison! Looking forward to seeing you around more of the community events this year. :)

name: Isabel Barganier
text: West and Wright is the best! I have loved living here and can’t wait to live here again next year!!! I love the big windows in my bedroom, the nice kitchen, and of course the location!! The staff is really dedicated to making sure that the residents are happy and they are always working to improve our experience at West and Wright!

resp.text: Your excitement is palpable, Isabel! So happy to be able to serve you, and can't thank you enough for noticing our efforts. :) You made the #wright choice!

name: Jordan Parker
text: Great location and appliances are new and modern. Furniture is also decent and relatively nice. However, wifi, parking and elevators are very unreliable and reduce the quality drastically as those are quite essential. At this price point, those should be a non-issue. Staff has gotten much better and more service oriented for sure. Hopefully they can figure out the major issues and this place will be much better!

resp.text: Thank you for the great remarks, Jordan. We're definitely pushing to see these changes happen sooner than later, and really appreciate the valuable input you and other residents have given us. Thanks for weighing all of your pros and cons efficiently for us to use as insight moving forward.

name: Helen Cornell
text: I have lived in this apartment for two years now, but only one year under the name and management of West and Wright. It is a great location for students at Auburn University as it is walking distance from campus and the downtown area. I have had a wonderful experience during my time living here, and I would highly recommend scheduling a tour.

resp.text: Thank you so much, Helen! We couldn't agree more; stop in for a tour at any time and see what Helen is talking about!

name: Bethany Johnson
text: West and Wright is in a great option for off campus student housing. The location was one of its biggest draws for me personally. Its extremely close to campus and in the heart of downtown!

resp.text: Location, location, location! Thank you so much for choosing W&W, Bethany. We're glad it's made living here so convenient for your college years. :)

name: Kathryn Hamilton
text: The location is perfect!! And the staff is always friendly and greets you with a smile! I love when amber works, she is always so nice and energetic! I would 10/10 recommend

resp.text: Amber is one of our faves, too! Thanks for the wonderful review, Kathryn. We always get bashful reading these kind-hearted resident reviews.

name: John Oneal
text:
Service is great. Free snacks, breakfast and lunch on occasion are very nice. But, if you're living here next year, you better pray that the construction is over and sky bar closes early. I have been woken up at 6 every morning this semester because of the noise. W&W always has some construction going on and it sucks. Also, due to the paper thin windows, the noise emitting from sky will also keep you up until 2am, the "great" location is not worth it. If you enjoy staying up until 2am and getting woken up at 6am, only being able to use one working elevator, spotty wifi, and oh! their pool gets less than a couple hours of full sun light, then this is the place for you.

The one star is for the service and free gifts, its a 0 star for everything else.

resp.text:
As a result of the cosmetic issues with the exterior bricks on the West and Wright building, the sidewalk on the east side of the building and the main entrance are temporarily closed in order to make necessary repairs. Until further notice, you may access the building through the garage entrance.

Our priority is the safety and well-being of our residents and staff and to make this as least disruptive as possible. We will be sure to provide updates as needed and communicate once the main entrance is re-open.

In the meantime, please don’t hesitate to reach out if you have any questions. We appreciate your patience and understanding.

name: fa knox
text: despite the negative reviews, I think that west & Wright has definitely improved in terms of service. The staff is helpful and they’ve gotten better about enforcing a lot of policies that people tend to break. Also, the location is prime- you can’t get much closer to downtown and an easy walk to campus.

resp.text: Thanks for detailing your viewpoint so well, and including how we've grown as compared to the reviews from the past. We're so happy with the prime location, and it feels great to be on the right track towards resident satisfaction.

name: Toby Snook
text: The location is about as good as it gets in Auburn. The amenities are great and staff is very nice. Can be quite loud at times but not to bad.

resp.text: Appreciate the sincerity, Toby. We do our best to keep the noise levels down in the complex, but as you're aware, it can still get a bit much at times. Feel free to stop in and chat with us about the measures we've taken to help those who'd like to report excessive noise on property.

name: Mackenzie VanSciver
text: Great location and great facility! Very modern apartment and a good place to live. Many giveaways too!

resp.text: Love to see your review come through, Mackenzie! We are in love with the units, too. Keep plugged in to our social media accounts to see more about our giveaways!

name: Kate Street
text: Wouldn’t recommend living here to anyone. Location is nice and the workers at the front desk are willing to help but the apartment itself sucks and my WiFi never worked, my room was a five minute walk from the elevator, the size of my room was the size of a closet, the fines are ridiculous and walls are incredibly thin.

resp.text:
Kate,
We are disappointed to learn that you have had a negative experience. We did have issues with the WiFi the first semester, but those issues were rectified by the installer over the holiday break. We thank all of our residents for their patience during that time. In addition, we do assess hefty fines for vandalism, as well as for causing the elevator to stop by jumping for example. The size of the units as well as the building we cannot control. We appreciate your feedback!
Best,
Evolve Auburn Management

name: Taylor Grant
text: Great location and fabulous stuff! Amber is always so helpful! Best place to live in all of auburn

resp.text: Thank you so much, Taylor! We're glad to have Amber here with us, she's an essential component of our team. If she or any of us can ever do anything for you, please let us know!

name: Sarah B
text: The staff has been really nice this year and I like the events we have had. It's nice being so close to the bars and campus

resp.text: Glad to have you as a part of our W&W family, Sarah!

name: Jessica Boone
text: GREAT location to campus and downtown and there are a few food places right downstairs so if you’re feeling lazy food is only a few steps away!

resp.text: Definitely one of our favorite aspects about living here too, Jessica! Thank you for an excellent review, and for providing some direct resident input on how awesome the location is.

name: Elizabeth Miles
text: Horrible place. The entrance is sometimes clean, the rest of the place is not. The reviews of Facebook must be from employees, because I haven’t talked to anyone here that likes it. If you have a question about anything, you’ll get 5 different answers from different employees, none of them will be the correct answer. The manager will only let you meet possible roommates, if you sign up for a year, so you could get a psychopath for a roommate & it’s not there problem. Hopefully, the new apartments being built next to them will be ready for next year. Not staying here a minute longer than I have to, there are plenty of other options.

name: Emma Robinson
text: Living downtown is so nice and convenient for walking to class!

resp.text: Thanks for choosing West & Wright for the convenience, Emma! We're glad you're enjoying your living space so much. :)

name: A Stubblefield
text: I absolutely love living here!! Great location! Great kitchen and appliances! Really want that iPad!!

resp.text: Thanks for the great review! We love the location, too. :) We appreciate you making the #wright choice.

name: Kassandra Mentlick
text: The tour was great and the people there were really nice! Keeping this place in mind when thinking of places to live next year!

resp.text: Thanks for stopping to chat with us, Kassandra! We're happy to answer any other questions you may have along the way. :)

name: Chris B
text: Haven't had cable since we moved in. Expect the internet to prevent you from doing homework sometimes. The overall quality of the building is bad, with bricks coming out or the wall already. Walls are paper thin. Place is always trashed, and there was a rotting pumpkin in the 6th floor hallway for 3 weeks. Elevators are under maintenance on almost a weekly basis. The only benefit is location. And if you want to have anyone over there is no real guest parking, they will tow anyone behind the gates without a pass despite the bottom floor having dozens of open spots year round.

resp.text: We sincerely appreciate your comments and concerns about your experience thus far with us, Chris. We’d love to meet with you to walk through some of these frustrations and get you the answers you desire, especially with that poor internet connection. Our maintenance crew has been hard at work identifying the causes for delay in trash and the elevator malfunctions. We also have new signage being added for parking in the next two weeks, which will include more options for guests. If you don’t have time to stop by and chat, you can always give us a call at (334) 350-3880 or email us atpjbeili@campusadv.com. Thanks again for the time you took to voice your concerns, Chris.

name: olivia ryan
text: WORST PLACE IN THIS COUNTRY. The fire alarms in our apartment have been going off for the past 8 hours and it is now midnight. This review is coming after several fire alarms and CARBON MONOXIDE alarms going off and two visits from the fire department because the maintenance and staff here just don't care. The emergency number listed is just the front desk voicemail which would be truly terrible if this entire place went down in flames or we all died of carbon monoxide poisoning. I have now had to pay several hundred dollars for hotel rooms because of these alarms. I could not recommend living anywhere less. Please for the love of all things do NOT live here.

resp.text:
Olivia,
We apologize for the negative experience you've had concerning noise and our staff. We encourage you to come by the office and mention your review to our manager Christina, so she can better understand your specific issues and help you come to a resolve.

Best,
West & Wright Mgmt.

name: JMan PDog
text:
Location is great, building is okay, and people in the back are nice. The only problem is to get to the people in the back if you have to deal with the people in the front who are rude or don't know anything. The blonde one who goes by Lindsay is the rudest person I've ever met in my life. Will look and talk to you like you're not good enough to be in her self entitled presence... and if you call the after hours phone and she pics up, good luck.
Maintenance is fine.
The events lately have been much better than the last when it was still called "the evolve." Not renewing due to bad wifi and no short term leases.

resp.text: Thanks for your valuable insight concerning our staff and internet. We're using information like this to assess where we can improve our operations, and this is a major help. Thanks for staying with us for the time you have!

name: Madison Boone
text: Had the nicest maintence man come fix our apartment and the tanning beds are working!!! However, the garage gates are down, trapping those who still have to work in. The manual button on gates don’t work either and when I called maintence emergency, voicemail. I’m assuming everyone is taking off for the snow day.

name: Evan Foy
text:
1) parking deck gates are constantly broken
2) the stairwells are disgusting and NEVER cleaned
3) cheap appliances
4) pretty sure the whole building is un-leveled.. my bedroom door closes on it's own and my bathroom door opens on it's own AND our balcony door had to be shaved because it started scraping the ground
5) elevators are always gross and sometimes broken
6) the trash shoot constantly overfills and therefore trash bags fill up the hallway and causes the hall to smell
7) the walls are PAPER thin
8) don't have a lot of major news channels
10) the trash man comes at 4am EVERYDAY and wakes everyone up

name: Chris Kauffman
text: Horrible place, built on a broken foundation, just built as soon as possible so they can provide terrible housing for a even more terrible price. Do not live here there is an abundance of better housing for a quarter of the price all around auburn.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Chris. We are happy to explain the safety measures of our complex to you in office at any time, so please come by and speak with a manager if you feel that your unit or any others is insufficient. Thank you for taking the time to let us know how you feel about West & Wright!

name: Sydney Mayson
text: I would tell EVERYONE not to live here. The WORST place and employees I have ever met. The place was trashed the entire year, not kept up with, and the management was extremely rude with terrible customer service. My room was the size of a closet and I was told I would have a room twice as big. My WiFi went out everyday which made it extremely hard to do my homework each night. I ordered a dress and was told it never came in, so I asked management if they knew anything and they said they accidentally sent it back to where it came from. When I asked for help to track the package or a refund they told me that I signed a contract saying I couldn’t get any compensation even thought this was EVOLVES MISTAKE for sending the package back. The main manager Christina is the most horrible person I have encountered with the WORST terrible service. I would advice anyone to stay away from her and to not get involved because she will be extremely rude to you.

resp.text:
Sydney,
We are disappointed to learn that you have had a negative experience. The size of the rooms cannot be controlled by us, and the WiFi was fixed over the winter holidays. In may we did accidentally send your package back. We went above and beyond trying to track down the package, while also speaking with the carriers in person about the package. in your signed lease agreement you agree to not hold us liable for any packages that may be damaged or lost that we received on your behalf. We appreciate your feedback!
Best,
Evolve Auburn Management

name: Julia Ruiz
text:
I lived in Evolve for a year, and I truly do not recommend this place. I have had numerous concerns with the building and management. A few problems began with the room size and furnishings. I signed a lease for a 175sqft bedroom. Upon a arrival, I received a bedroom that was 86 sqft. the room was so small, my closet door had to be removed because I could not open it with the furniture. My desk had to be replaced, because that too, was too large for my room. (all of this furniture was provided by evolve). If you are living in a outside 2 bedroom corner unit (520A-920A), good luck. However, this became the least of my problems in the end.

My real concerns regard the structural integrity of the building itself. My room had numerous cracks that went through the wall onto the other side. My door had to be shaved down multiple times throughout the year due to the shifting structure. Dry wall constantly flaked, and my bathroom floor started to separate from the tub and toilet. A close friend of mine from the construction company that built evolve told me that there was an ongoing lawsuit because the structural engineers for the complex were negligent in the structural design. (specifically with the pools weight on the fifth floor). Yet management will tell you its just settling concrete. Evolve has its perks, with location and amenities. However much of this was outweighed by the negatives

resp.text:
Julia,
We are disappointed to learn that you have had a negative experience. The City of Auburn has had structural engineers sign off on the safety and integrity of the building, as well as three additional independent engineers that were hired by both previous and current owners. All reports show that there is some expected settling in that building, but it is typical. There has never been any issue with our pool, it is a rumor that it is falling into the parking garage. This came forward when our retail tenants were doing construction in the parking garage to run water and electricity to their business spaces from the other side of the building. In regard to the size of your room, we have given a $50 monthly concession to you. We appreciate your feedback!
Best,
Evolve Auburn Management

name: Savannah N
text: I would not recommend this apartment to anyone. The cons definitely outweigh the pros here. It’s ridiculously expensive for tiny rooms and a tiny closet. There is constant traffic outside and constant contruction noise. Don’t even think about sleeping on the weekends because there’s people raging in the rooms next to you pregaming for downtown. I’m on the 7th floor and I can hear people having normal level conversations outside. The parking deck is awful. People speed, it’s hard to maneuver around, and people are constantly parking in the deck without decals and parking in spots that are not actual spots therefore blocking other people in. There’s also no guest parking so if you have friends they probably won’t be coming over. They also have the WORST staff and management I’ve ever dealt with. I got locked out of my room one night and tried calling the emergency after hour numbers multiple times and they never answered so I slept on our couch. Some of them are nice but most are incompetent and even rude. The manager Christina is rude and mean. She literally yelled at me before I moved in and was scolding me like a child. I honestly don’t see how she still has a job here because she’s terrible. Really, the only good thing about living here is the location, and sometimes they give us free food. It’s just not worth it.

resp.text: Savannah, we are very upset to read how much you've negatively experienced at West & Wright thus far. We'd encourage you to come by our office to speak on behalf of the troubles you've faced, so we can try and resolve them for you. We'd hate for these problems to persist. We look forward to connecting with you.

name: Prashanth Murali
text:
Total rip off. Rooms are so small, "furniture" is of very cheap quality, wifi is just too slow. The mattresses they provide almost feel like bricks. Closet is too small and theres just no storage space in the apartment to even put away boxes from appliances you bought.

Overall, it just doesn't feel like its worth the package you get. You can find more space and facilities for half the price really considering I lived in a 5 bedroom apartment and paid 900$ for it. I'd feel better if the furniture was of better quality and the rooms were much much much larger.

Update : Impossible to break your lease in case you're forced to relocate to a different city if you don't wan't to shed out a few grand. Also, impossible to find someone to sublet because of their ridiculous no pet policy and well, the ridiculous price.

resp.text:
Prash,

Thank you for your incredibly honest account of your stay with us at Evolve Auburn. We tried reaching out to discuss more about your review, and what we could do to help facilitate your needs. If possible, give the leasing office a ring, or stop in sometime and tell us more about the changes you'd like to see to your unit. We'd love the opportunity.

Best,
Evolve Auburn

name: Hailey O
text:
Some of the reviews of this place are obsurd and need to be taken with a grain of salt. So many people complaining about late charges and convienence fees... like you’re the one that paid your rent late lol how is that their fault? You knew there were late fees and convenience fees when you signed up... get a checkbook like I did or set up a recurring payment jeez.
I love the apartment and it feels super safe being a girl. The doors lock at night, there are gates, security cameras, and lights in the parking deck. It’s annoying people come on here to complain that the elevator may break once in a blue moon, WHEN THE REASON IT BREAKS IS BECAUSE ANNOYING PEOPLE JUMP ON IT. Like how is it their fault when they’re constantly fixing it?
The staff is pretty nice and the location to campus and downtown is amazing. We renewed our lease to stay another year

resp.text: Really appreciate your review, and considering the other reviews in the process. We'll always try to fix/repair anything that residents bring to our attention, and hope that your review helps shed some light on that. Thank you again!

name: David P.
text:
In my opinion...

Evolve Auburn poses a novel question: if you construct a mega-million dollar complex with state-of-the-art amenities and the best location in Auburn, how long does it take to run it into the dirt?

I thought the train wreck that was move-in day was one of the worst experiences of my life, but it was only downhill from there. At Evolve, move-in resembled a WWE Royal Rumble. Entering the deck on move-in day took two hours. The lines for the elevator were longer than those for Space Mountain, so we had to climb the stairs with our arms full of heavy boxes. I had lived in the dorms at Auburn previously, and they staggered the move-in days. The management at Evolve, however, thought it was a great idea to have 1000 people show up all at once trying to cram their stuff up the building.

The management is not so much malevolent as they are incompetent. They are unknowledgeable and unprofessional. My work order took over a month to complete because the management ordered the wrong part. The wi-fi is spotty. Heaps of garbage bags accumulate in the hall. After the elevators were overworked during move-in day, the residents compounded the abuse by splattering them with vomit. The whole place just reeks. If you still want to live here, I’d recommend a HAZMAT suit and experience at a bio level 4 lab. But seriously, always carry hand sanitizer and shower twice a day.

As bad as the management was, some of the tenants tried their very hardest to out-do them. The delinquents stripped the buildings of all signage: room numbers, elevator signs, even the exit signs. It’s going to be a disaster the day someone gets alcohol poisoning because the 911 first responders will die of old age before they find where to go. If you want a good night’s sleep, your best bet is to go to your car, which will not be anywhere near the assigned parking spot that you paid for.

In the end, what should have been a great experience was marred by constant frustration and disappointment. For what it’s worth, however, Evolve did provide one of the best days of my life: the day I moved out.

name: Steve Jones
text:
This place nickle and dimes you to death.  A convenience fee of $18 to pay on line.  Getting my daughter checks so she we can save the $18 and make one of the children running this place go to the bank.  Convenience fee for who I ask?  I pay all my bills on line.  There are a few convenience fees like the water bill, it is $1.
Last year they changed the late date from the 5th to the 4th.  Some Accountant figured they could make XXXX dollars by doing that.  Oh and if the 4th is on a Saturday or Sunday well you have to pay it on Friday or you get a late fee.  Late fees are $40 a day. So we blew $80 because I figured we could pay it Monday with the 4th being on a Sunday.  I have rented for three children for a total of 9 years, less the dorm and this is the most ridiculous  set up I have seen or heard of.
Can't wait for all those new high rises to pop up.

name: Peyton Osborne
text: The absolute worst place I have ever lived. Terrible online portal, dorm size rooms. I was extremely disappointed and encourage people to live anywhere else

resp.text: We're sorry to hear that your experience wasn't positive, Peyton. We encourage you and any other resident to bring forward any issues you have to the leasing office. :)

name: Joel Johnson
text: The staff if very nice and knowledgeable.

resp.text: The residents are also pretty nice and knowledgable. -staff. ;)

name: Allen Boone
text: This place is the worst possible choice for living at Auburn. I’m actually embarrassed to say I live here. “Rumors” going around town that the building is not sound and when called with my questions of concern, I was laughed at and told by worker Taylor, “I have a degree in building science and architecture and I have no idea what you are talking about”. Well, for starters, if you were successful, you wouldn’t be a “manager”of an apartment complex. You should be utilizing those two expensive degree you just got. If the building is so sound, how come 20+ spots are marked off with DANGER tape on the second floor? According to rumor, it’s because the ceiling is collapsing due to the pool being on the 5 floor... I have never been given an answer as to what the problem is so the only thing left to do is assume. Also, the WiFi has never worked (yes we had to do without WiFi for finals week)  and evolve stated over break the company synergy put in more access points but guess what.... WiFi still doesn’t work. Tenants have actually purchased their own routers but continue to pay for non existent WiFi in evolve. There are also over 30 lights out which is a major safety hazard.

name: Canon Kuipers
text: Great staff, always available for help.

resp.text: Glad to be of service to you, Canon. Thanks for an excellent review!

name: Sydney Rush
text:
DO NOT LIVE HERE
1.) all of the room numbers have been stolen of the majority of floors. When I have guests they literally can’t find my room number.
2.) the place is a mess. There’s is bean dip dripping down the yellow walls in the hallway right by my room. It’s been there for TWO MONTHS. This place is supposed to be nice and it’s a pig stine.
3.) the tanning beds have been broken for months. We spoke with the owners of a near by tanning salon and they said the parts only taken about two weeks to come in so your excuse of “the part hasn’t come in yet” isn’t okay. This is an amenity that was included with the apartment. This will not do.
4.) the WiFi is a joke. We called the WiFi provider and he said several rooms in evolve were “missed” upon set up and simply don’t get WiFi. Another amenity we’re being ripped off on.
5.) You blare music so loud at the pool in the middle of the day that I can’t do my homework or even hear my TV because the walls were made so cheap and they’re paper thin.
6.) many have reported not having the right couch they payed for
7.) no private 9th floor access
8.) the halls reek of trash and I’m embarrassed that this is where we live when we have guest or my parents come
9.) TV channels consistently go out

name: Blair Varnell
text:
Walls are paper thin along with floor and ceiling. If you want to be woken up at 2 AM to the people around you JUST starting to party, this place is for you.
We have not had apartment numbers since the beginning bc the people that live here do not have any respect for this place or anyone else but themselves.
WiFi is very spotty, doesn’t work
If you come on a weekend you get to see so many beer bottles and throw up
People leave their trash outside the door to the trash chute— WHEN THE TRASH CHUTE WORKS
the tanning beds don’t work & we still pay for them monthly.

name: Trevor Hill
text: MGMT does not care. The door signs were stolen over a month ago and have not been replaced. Apparently the cost of building this behemoth has left the owners without the capital to perform basic maintenance.

name: Morgan Young
text:
This apartment complex is the equivalent of Toby from The Office.

Serious note though, from the times I’ve stayed here with friends there’s constant throw up or some kind of bodily fluid in the halls at all times. Very nasty

name: Mackenzie Carnes
text: very poorly run business. i would much rather live at 221 or edge west. seriously the worst place to live.

name: Chris Jones
text: Rooms are nice, but the halls and stairs are gross and the Internet sucks

name: Graham Woodington
text: Living here is the most frustrating thing you will ever do in your entire life. Just don't do it. I'm actually begging you not to give these people your money, the staff and management do not care and will not help you with anything. I wish I could write multiple one star reviews but sadly, I can't.

name: Ryan Nichols
text: Close to downtown, close to campus

resp.text: Close to a perfect review. ;) Thanks, Ryan!

name: Mary Michelle Stokes
text: Great Location!!

resp.text: Thank you, Mary!

name: Carson Speaks
text: This place is a joke

name: Joel carpenter
text: The honors dorm on campus. A great spot in the middle of everything.

name: Stephanie TheAnimeLover
text: Excellent place, I like this place.

name: Carson Elmore
text: The best dorm on Montevallo's campus. Worth all the work of the Honors Program just to get to live in Ramsay and have a fantastic college experience. Private bathroom with your roommate, rooms set up hotel style, and a great study lounge in the Basement.

name: Cassidy Acuff Williams
text: This place is much older but it is clean and quiet..

name: Alexia Wilson
text: Out of all the places on campus I could have stayed my first year, I’m glad I got Cambridge. It’s not too far from campus or downtown. You only share your room/bathroom with one other person so you get a decent amount of space. My only problem was that there isn’t a community kitchen and they closed the little convenience store down, so you have to go out to eat. Overall a good place to live. More space than quad & hill and less $ than village & south Donahue.

name: Jay Bouchard
text: was a resident here in Fall 2017. it's an ok place. its just not easy to make friends. I had a bad RA where I was on the 4th floor I him for some help on how to make friends & get involved and he didn't help in the slightest. the RA's need more training

name: Cecili
text: Do not bother with this place. They need a renovation and new/better management. The meals are not free. They are included in your lease/rent. During the summer, their hours are extremely inconvenient. My job on campus let's out at 5pm and by that time dinner is over. There isn't even the OPTION to NOT have the meal plan. It is a complete ripoff. The choices are abysmal and the staff unbelievably rude!!! The room I was given has a leaking closet with tiles missing and a bucket as a bonus. Any maintenance requests were COMPLETELY ignored. I definitely would not have stayed here if it was for my short notice on a research position for just a few months. I have absolutely nothing positive to say about this place at all. Save yourself the headache don't bother.

name: Ferendez
text: Owned by the university now and I loved staying there my first year at Auburn

name: Mrs. Carla Reid
text: Terrible customer service (Mandi Harper) should seek customer service classes and proper conversational skills.  The food is horrible, please don't be born with any allergies or the need to eat healthy.  Meal options and schedule for meals are less than desirable if you don't get hungry at their convenience.  Response time for repairs and communication are pathetic.  Make time to contact them two/three times a day for any repairs.  make sure you have an iPad, or computer available for correspondence since they refuse to return or answer a call.  to talk to anyone with sense or manners you have to show up face-to-face since " Owner is in and out" your concerns or issues are of no importance to the person who makes the discussions.

name: Kimberly Faubion
text: Beautiful old building

name: John Petersen
text: One of the nicest dorms on campus. They have two bedroom apartment style, and four bedroom apartment style rooms. Everyone has their own room and they share a bathroom for two people, along with a common space. Very nice and not too expensive.

name: robbie or brian malone
text: My daughter lives here. That's probably why it's the best.

name: Pratiksha Joshi
text: Clean and well maintained. Comfortable

name: Zheng Zhifei
text: very nice place

name: Joe Price
text: Nice ,clean & secure

name: Jalen Cates
text: Only reviewing to say that the other guy obviously hasn't lived here. Has no idea what he is talking about. -RA in Blount Hall

name: Irene Falls
text: I work here cleaning the dorm

name: Sam Wight
text: This is an alright dorm to live in, not the best that UA has to offer, but pretty good. There are a lot of requirements as far as classes go that you have to follow, as you have to be a Blount Scholar to be in this dorm. This is a traditional dorm, so you will be staying with a roommate and won't have your own private space like you would in suite dorms such as Ridgecrest, Lakeside, or Presidential. There are some pretty cool common areas to gather, but they aren't as good as New Freshman. Location is alright, but not any better than Ridgecrest, and you don't have the advantages of having a parking garage right under your dorm. If you have a car and live here, you're basically forced to park in the Ferg parking lot or one of the commuter lots. Not my favorite dorm on campus, but it's also not the worst.

name: Lisa Getts-Folsom
text: I was making a delivery, it is a nice facility.  University of AL always great

name: blake evans
text: I pay good money to live here. The only people that care for anyone here is the people that work under management. I have more than once had issues with management and infact taken it without argument. I ask for one request ever in return. But instead of being about to talk to management personally, they decline my request to do so. It seems they do not have enough time to speak directly with their paying residents. Disgraceful.

name: Jordan DeLoney
text: The walls and ceilings are very thin and will not allow you like to study in your room if you need a quiet space. Their study rooms are also not an option because they are right below the gym. In addition, the Wifi is always out and there are problems with the hot water. I did not enjoy staying here.

resp.text: We’re sorry to hear about that! Please feel free to contact the Management Office or call our Customer Service Team at 512-732-1099 so we can discuss your review in detail. - Corporate Customer Service

name: Smoothiedude Dayton
text:
My daughter was a tenant for two years. All things considered, it was a good place to live. I do have three gripes that were never addressed.

1.) The biggest. There is no formal protocol in place if a tenant tests positive for CV-19. They say they can't ask a resident if they are positive and do nothing to safeguard the other "roommates" or their staff, for that matter. Thank goodness her roommate left and quarantined back in Atlanta.

2.) There is not a mechanism in place if a roommate decides to bring in pets and not tell the management team.  I complained on more than one occasion last spring, but, they did nothing to rid the unit of a dog and hamster.

3. I'm still waiting on my deposit to be returned. I have not received any indication of any outstanding balances and wonder if I will ever get my deposit. They were very adamant about getting the deposit initially.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We know you have other housing options, and we appreciate that your daughter chose 160 Ross for two years. We’re sorry your daughter had a bad experience. We have policies for each one of your concerns and welcome the opportunity to speak with you via phone. If you’d like, please give the Management Office a call or contact the Customer Service Department at 512-732-1099 to discuss your review. Thank you. -Jessica L. [Customer Service]

name: Meleah Montgomery
text: It is a nice apartment with good amenities, but the WiFi is terrible. With some classes being remote this school year, it is sometimes impossible to get work done here because the WiFi barely works.

resp.text: Meleah, we’re sorry to hear about your issues with the Wifi! Please feel free to contact the Management Office or call our Customer Service Team at 512-732-1099 so we can discuss your review in detail. - Rachel K. [Customer Service]

name: Emily Dunlap
text: I want to start off by saying the manager there Bre Davis is absolutely amazing! She is super friendly and has went out of her way to help in anyway she can! I would highly recommend 160 Ross to anyone looking for great apartments in Auburn!

resp.text: Thank you for your great review !

name: robert jenning
text: This is probably one of the worst apartments in Auburn. Don’t rely on them to help your child or yourself in general. They will try to screw you over every way possible. Good thing they made a contract with Auburn University to be a “freshman dorm” because otherwise they wouldn’t have ANYONE living here. Do the best for yourself, and your child, and don’t live here. Find a more reliable and responsive management. It seems like a good deal, but there’s a reason for that...

resp.text: Robert, thank you for taking the time to leave us your feedback about 160 Ross. We value you as a customer and welcome the opportunity to discuss your concerns in more detail.  You may call the Management Office or contact the Customer Service Team at 512-732-1099 if you would like to discuss your review. - Rachel K. [Customer Service]

name: Anthony Hayes
text: Fantastic amenities and management always go the extra mile! Misty and Breanda are always such a joy to be around

resp.text: Thank you so much for your wonderful review !

name: trent ashoo
text: 5 stars for KEN, he is the absolute man! He’s got a ton of knowledge about the building and if he doesn’t know how to fix something he is resourceful and timely. The building building kinda sucks. We had a leak in the apartment and in the hall. GOOD THING KEN IS THE BOY!

resp.text:
Trent,
Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback. We're so happy to hear that Ken is resourceful and doing a great job. I'll make sure to pass along the kind words to him. - Lauren K.

name: KK L
text: The management and front desk staff have bent over backwards to help us. They have been professional, prompt and kind. As a a parent, we appreciate all that they did to help us out of a terrible situation at another apartment complex in August and got us in to an apartment the week that classes started (a day earlier than promised). Recently, they have been very helpful and straightforward renewing our lease for next year. The facilities and apartments are beautiful and safe and the team supporting the residents is top notch.

resp.text:
Hi,
That's what we like to hear, and we are glad we were able to help you all out this past August!  Thanks so much for the feedback - it's so appreciated. -Lauren K.

name: Alissa Heath
text: I have lived here for two years and it has been a very nice experience. I never had to wait more than an hour to get something fixed if something was broken in my apartment and also the management and workers at the front desk are always so sweet! It is also a plus to have everything so clean all the time compared to other complexes I have lived in before. I would recommend living here to anybody!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the kind words Alissa!  We wish you luck in your future career and will miss your smiling face when you graduate!

name: John Daily
text:
160 Ross are some snakes.
they told my roomates and I that if we did not resign when we did back in November the rates would be hundreds of dollars higher.  Here we are in August and they are offering free months of rent and rates $200 less a month for people that sign now. They tricked us and I would highly NOT recommend signing a lease with this apartment complex.

resp.text: Hi John, thanks for your feedback.  We know you have other housing options, and we appreciate that you chose 160 Ross. We’re sorry you’re unhappy with our current specials. 160 Ross strives to give our returning residents the best rates, but it sounds like we fell short.  If you’d like, please give the Management Office a call or contact the Customer Service Department at 512-732-1099 to discuss your review. Thank you - Caithn S. [Corporate Customer Service]

name: Bailey
text: The fire alarm will go off at any time (almost daily) for at least 30 minutes. It is such an ear-piercing sound and the staff has never apologized for it going off so many times. It also goes off very late, sometimes at 4AM. It is the most annoying thing I've ever had to deal with and they are doing NOTHING to fix it. Unacceptable. Walls are paper-thin and you can hear every single thing from your neighbors room. Neighbors from upstairs are even worse. If they are just walking around, it sounds like they are jumping on the floors as hard as they can. Don't fall victim to the "positive" reviews. Don't live here. There are better options

resp.text: Hey Baily, I'm sorry that you were experiencing issues with the fire alarm. This issue has been resolved but if you would like to discuss your experience further, please give our Management Office or Corporate Customer Service Team a call at 512-732-1099. - Rachel K. [Customer Service]

name: Beth Thomas
text:
PLEASE READ BEFORE YOU DECIDE.  I feel compelled to write this review to warn present and future renters/parents of the issues with leasing at 160 Ross. My son has rented from 160 Ross and is now in his 4th lease. As noted, the rent rises every year with no new updates inside or out. THIS IS NOT WHY I AM WRITING.
This year because the complex did not fully rent out my son is in a 4 bedroom apartment by himself. Some would think this is a great thing but be warned, regardless as to the number of un-rented bedrooms in the unit, the utilities for that unit are the responsibility of whomever is living there. His utility bill for June and July was over$160+/mo total.  He does not use or have access to the other 3 bedrooms. After several discussions the complex agreed to subsidize the other 3 rooms @ $20 each (which is part of their lease agreement). That is helpful but does not cover the full utilities for the apartment unused spaces. Less the subsidy his portion was $80+.  Since he has lived there for 3+ years and in the same room for the last 2+ years he knows what his utility bills averaged.  He has never paid over $30+/mo. I thought these were supposed to be individual leases and a shared utility bill. He has no option other than to sublet (HA! HA! like anyone would be ignorant enough to do this) or pay the higher utility bills for the remainder of his lease. 160 Ross chose not to put anyone in this apartment and instead optioned to fill up other apartments. He did not even know he was not going to have roommates till July of 2019, well past his time to get out of a lease that was signed back in Nov. of 2018.  When you get down to it 160 Ross has decided he was going to be alone in the apartment and would be subject to cover all the utilities over the paltry subsidy. As I said before I would think very carefully about moving yourself or your son/daughter into 160 Ross or any American Campus Facility given the treatment of the residents.

name: Elizabeth Taylor
text: The staff at 160 Ross provides such a warm and welcoming environment every time I walk into the office. Misty and Lauren do such a great job at what they do and you can tell they really care about not only the property but every single one of the residents! I highly suggest checking out 160 Ross!

name: Tristan Hazebrook
text: I’ve lived here for the past two years and loved it. The amenities are great and there’s always fun stuff going on for residents. The pool is perfect and stays in the sun super long.

resp.text: Hey Tristan, we are so glad you are our resident!! Resident's like you make 160 Ross an AMAZING place to live! - Lauren K

name: Tatom Moore
text: I’ve lived here for 2 years & I’m living here next year because I absolutely love it! Lauren & Misty & the entire rest of the staff are always super helpful. I also love the amenities & the covered parking!

name: Andrew Lipscomb
text: Awesome place to live! Work orders are fulfilled super quick. The wifi has been upgraded recently and is very fast. I can stream 4k video with no buffering, and I've never had any issues while playing online video games. they take care of all the things that you wouldn't otherwise think about. For example, I've never seen a single bug in my apartment, and that is absolutely not the case for my friends living in other apartments. Everyone who works here is very approachable, knowledgeable, and dedicated.

resp.text: Hey Andrew, we are so glad we are able to take care of any issues quickly for you! I'll pass along the praise as well to our maintenance staff for all of their hard work. - Lauren K

name: colin rossi
text: Overall my experience living at 169 hasn’t been great, overages are made up and overcharged every month along with countless other issues the complex has.  However the one plus side has been the maintenance man Ken Howard.  Anytime we have had an issue Ken always comes through and does above and beyond what we requested.

resp.text: Hi Colin, Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. Thanks for the shout out to our Maintenance Tech, Ken! We're sorry to hear that you are getting overcharged and that the overages are not being clearly explained to you. If you would like to discuss the charges on your account, we're here to help. Give our Management Office our Customer Service Team a call at 512-732-1099 to discuss your review. Thank you - Caithn S. [Corporate Customer Service]

name: Noelle Johnson
text: Nice and friendly staff!! Quick to complete work orders. Environment is kept clean and fun to live in! Lauren at the front is awesome!

resp.text: Thanks, Noelle for the shout out! I'll also pass along the praises to our maintenance team! - Lauren K

name: Davi
text:
Update, Missy resolved the issue, she handled it well. They still need to amend their contract with the towing company so that it does not grant so much  autbority to the towing company, their interpretation  of towable vehicles is bias.
I am dumbfounded that this company would allow a towing company to enter a permit only garage and tow the cars. According to Auburn Express towing, they have a deal with the complex to tow any car that does not display both the hang tag and decal to their satisfaction. One of the primary reasons students have cars is for their safety. This compromises their safety, because it subjects them to unsafe alternatives when their vehicles are wrongfully towed. I would understand if the complex issued warnings regarding the accurate placement of decals. I wonder what incentives the towing company offers the complex to give them such liberal access to a permit only garage. I am angry that my child, a resident, was left vulnerable.

resp.text: Hi Davi. Thank you for sharing your sentiments about our towing policies. We have the contract to tow in place to avoid illegal parking or non-residents and visitors taking up spaces. If we don't have those rules in place, our residents are inconvenienced by outsiders taking their spots. If you have suggestions on how to avoid this, please feel free to contact the management office or customer service at 512-732-1099. Thank you. - Taniya R. [Corporate Customer Service]

name: Molly Cassidy
text: I’ve lived here for a year now and it’s an awesome complex! great amenities and very helpful office staff! an awesome place if you want to be close to campus!!

resp.text: We're so glad you love calling 160 Ross your home. Stop by our office anytime you have any questions. -Lauren K

name: Alice Baker
text: Lived here for 3 years and absolutely loved it! The workers are very helpful and maintence requests are complete in a short period of time. Pool and amenities are great.

name: Gabby Burns
text: I have lived here for 3 years and have loved it! It is a great place to live with great amenities!! The staff is always so helpful!

name: Piper
text: 160 ross has amazing and friendly staff. The amenities are great and are always a fun time. Shout out Amelia law for being so amazing at the front desk!

resp.text: Thank you, Piper! Positive feedback from our residents is always so appreciated - we'll certainly pass your shout out along to Amelia. -Lauren K

name: Tori Warren
text: I have truly enjoyed living here in 160 Ross.  Why? Because of the wonderful amenities, helpful staff, and exciting neighbors.  I have had no real problems with 160.  However, I do wish the lighting was brighter.  Other than that I love 160!! Would recommend.

name: Jackenstein
text: Many of times have I hated living here. The walls are as thin as can be and people are always partying loud enough for you to hear then across both courtyards 3 nights a week. The parking deck is dangerous to drive in and is running out of space to park since few residents are willing to pay for the “reserved” parking at $25 a month. I just got towed since I didn’t have my hang tag on my car for about 48 hours while being parked in a spot that I’m normally allowed to park in. This happened without my knowledge since I was out of town for the weekend. It happened even though I had my sticker that said my car’s allowed to park in the deck in addition to them having my license plate and description of my car on file so they know the owner of the car lives here! You’d think that would be enough or that someone would have the decency to let me know my car has been towed! The hallways are always trashed and cleaned on Friday morning before they get messed up again Friday and Saturday night. Resident activities are a waste of money and the good ones require you to show up a good amount of time before it starts to even allow you to get so much as a chicken biscuit. Finally, the wifi is either not working or acting like it works while still not working. All of this can be yours for the hefty price tag of 12 payments of $749 a month not including the skyrocketing prices of utilities. The price keeps going up even though the value keeps going down. Bottom line, you’d be better off elsewhere in more ways than one!

resp.text: Hi Jackson. We appreciate your feedback and we’re sorry for any frustration you may have experienced with all of the issues you listed.  Please feel free to contact our Management Office or the Customer Service Department at 512-732-1099 to discuss your concerns in detail.

name: Anna Sleeman
text: I love living here! There is always cool activities like food trucks and the pool is sweet! Great location!

resp.text: Thanks, Anna! We try to make sure our resident events are always a ton of fun! - Lauren K

name: Stephanie Freeman
text: I generally enjoy living here, they always have fun events going on and free food for different things as well. Our apartment unfortunately flooded but the staff was really helpful and nice and was able to get us back into our apartment very efficiently. I would recommend living here ! Also very easy to get to university by either walking or the transit.

name: Lauren Hurston
text: I have had a great experience living here. The staff is nice and friendly and very helpful if you ever have questions. They always have events going on and free food etc. for the residents. The pool and workout room are extremely nice and the game room is an awesome study break. I really love living here and would definitely recommend it to anyone!

name: Ally Douglas
text: If I could give them -5 stars I would. 160 was awful. I could have lived through the paper thin walls, floors, and ceilings if it weren't for the management. They tried to fine us for a noise complaint when that night 1 person was home. The only reason complaints were answered for our unit was because the girls below us worked at 160 which shows the poor management style and unprofessional manner they operated in. Will not be returning next year.

resp.text: Hey Ally, thanks for taking the time to leave us a review. I'm sorry to hear that you had issues with Management and that you had a noise violation that you were unable to dispute. Please give our Corporate Customer Service Team a call if you would like to further discuss your experience. We would love to see how we can help. Customer Service can be reached at 512-732-1099 or CustomerService@AmericanCampus.com. - Rachel K. [Cusotmer Service]

name: Elias Hiskey
text:
great amenities, a nice workout room and good pool.
solid location, easy to walk to campus or downtown
fun environment

resp.text: We love all of these things about our community too! Thanks for the review - Lauren K

name: Eddie Reyes
text: DO NOT BE SCAMMED BY 160 ROSS!! Please avoid this place at all costs. Do not fall for the nice rooms that they advertise. Walls are paper thin and the people that live here no respect for others and play their music as loud as possible and as late as possible. If you live in front of one of the roads prepare for a lot of traffic noise that wakes you up in the morning before your alarm does. And don't expect to come into a nice clean room when you first move in, instead expect it to be dusty, dirty, and dark. I wish I had seen the bad reviews before I signed my $759 12 month lease that is now being advertised for $649. And apparently all the good reviews are from people who were told they would get free food if they put a 5 star review on here. Yikes!

resp.text: Hi Eddie, We’re sorry to hear about your bad experience at 160 Ross. We continually strive to exceed customer expectations with our units, however, based on your review it sounds as though we fell short.   Please feel free to contact our Management Office or the Customer Service Department at 512-732-1099 to discuss your concern in detail. Thank you - Caithn S. [Corporate Customer Service]

name: Carly Porep
text: The staff is amazing!!! The are always so friendly when I walk inside and always willing to help with anything.

name: Kelly Andreone
text: I’ve lived here for the past year and it’s great! I love being so close to campus!

resp.text: That's what we like to hear. Thanks so much for the feedback, and we LOVE being close to campus too. — Lauren K

name: Shelby Gustin
text: 160 ross is a super fun place to live and they take care of everything in a timely manner! Lauren’s the best!

resp.text: Yay! We love our residents, and positive feedback is always so appreciated.-Lauren K

name: sam jones
text: one time someone threw up in the stairwell and it wasn't cleaned for two weeks. also the pool in consistently green. the gates are often broken. they tell you the utility bill is usually $10 or less but it is much more expensive than that. DONT LIVE HERE

resp.text: Hi Sam, wow, that is unfortunate to hear that a mess was not cleaned up for a few weeks. It's always important to contact the office so that it may be addressed. We’re sorry that you had a bad experience.  Please give the Management Office or Customer Service Team a call, so we can discuss your concerns in detail.  The Customer Service Team can be reached at 512-732-1099. - Rachel K. [Customer Service]

name: Caroline Baehr
text: 160 Ross is not the place for you if you have sensitive ears. The walls are paper thin, you can hear everything from all directions(outside and inside). We got over 10 noise complaints because the people under us worked here, 8/10 of those were from us simply walking around.  The people above us are extremely loud, but we never called a noise complaint because we understood that the walls were so thin. The study rooms are loud because they are right underneath the gym so you can hear treadmills if you are trying to study. Simply don't live here if you can't handle a bunch of noise. 100% not renewing our lease.

resp.text: Hey Caroline! I'm really sorry to hear that you had issues with the neighbors below you and that you felt the walls and floors weren't sound proof. We appreciate your feedback. Please give our Corporate Customer Service Team a call if you would like to further discuss your review. We can be reached at 512-732-1099. - Rachel K. [Customer Service]

name: Lauren Brands
text: 160 has been awesome! Both management and maintenance are great. Anytime you have an issue they always work to do everything that they can! Although you do live in close proximity to your neighbors (just the nature of being in any apartment complex) the staff has measured in place to help out anytime there are any issues. Was originally worried about the negative reviews before signing my lease, but so glad I took them with a grain of salt. Glad to be a part of this community!

resp.text:
Lauren,

We are glad you are a part of our community too! Thank you for your review. It’s always our goal at 160 Ross to provide the best customer service possible. Feel free to contact our office if you need anything and once again thank you!

name: D. East Cobb Mom
text:
We have been renters for one year in Ross and wish now we had never entered the front door.  Our experience is the same as a previous poster John Daily.

We were charged rent August 1st but only allowed in August 15th. The room was not freshly painted and we cannot understand the delay.

Only having lived there a few weeks, we were pressured to sign a new annual lease for the following year with an increase to the rate. Concerned and nervous, we signed a new lease in October with a new monthly rate for their cheapest room at 759.00.  This same room has been renting for 649.00 since April and they now allow for ten month terms.  We feel taken advantage of and very upset that  no one in the office will rent us our room at the current rate.  Beware of Ross, a lot of pressure, they are salesmen not community assistants.

resp.text: Hello there, Thank you for taking the time to leave us your feedback. We're sorry to hear that you are unhappy. 160 Ross values you as a customer, and we welcome the opportunity to discuss your concerns with the rental rates in more detail.  You may call the Management Office or contact the Customer Service Team at 512-732-1099 if you would like to discuss your review.  Thank you - Caithn S. [Corporate Customer Service]

name: Katie
text: I would not recommend living at 160 Ross. Like everyone has previously stated, the walls are extremely thin. I can hear the conversations of the people who live beside me, above me, below me, and in the courtyard. The parking garage is also extremely tight, and people drive recklessly. If I come home past 7 PM, I can only find parking on the top floor. Further, if I ever have any problems such as noise complaints or maintenance issues, I no longer bother reporting them knowing how they’ve completely ignored or mishandled my complaints in the past. 160 Ross seemed like a nice place to live in originally because it’s proximity to campus and it’s amenities, but after living here for over a year now I’d highly suggest anyone looking to live here to consider looking elsewhere. Lastly, all the positive comments posted a month ago were only posted because those who did post positive comments could receive free food.

resp.text: Katie, We're sorry that you were disappointed with your experience. Please reach out to our office at 334-332-9736 - we'd love to discuss your situation in detail and make it right. - Lauren K.

name: Tyler Dollar
text: I've lived here since it open and I love it for what you get you really pay a good price considering how expensive other places are for the same style of living. My roommates are great and we all renewed to live here for our third year

name: Brenna Fowler
text: I absolutely love living here! It is a close walk to campus, and parking is not an issue at all (it is now). Definitely recommend checking this place out if you're looking into living off-campus! Just kidding, they upped the rates $60.

name: Cameron Humphrey
text: I like this place. close to campus (close enough to walk). Prices are iffy but understandable. The staff is cool, the people that live here are cool. Overall a nice place to live.

name: Catie Asarch
text: 160 is a great place to live! We love it!!! It’s close to campus and a perfect place!

resp.text: Thank you. We love our 160 Ross residents, and your feedback means a lot to us.-Lauren K

name: Amber Jackson
text: I enjoyed the activities and amenities that 160 Ross provided; however, the roommate matching system needs improvement.

resp.text:
Hi Amber,
Thanks so much for the feedback - it's so appreciated. -Lauren K

name: Curtis Mitchell
text: I've lived here since 160 Ross opened and I must say.. Its LIT!! I absolutely love this place. the game room compared to the other apartments I have visited is simply awesome. The rooms are great and considering I only have to pay rent because my utilities are included is a big plus. The only knock I have on this place is parking. Yea we have a parking deck but its really tight. also Their isn't enough space for my guests to park so they run the risk of getting towed a lot . but other than that, the place is great!

name: Maddy Bergeron
text: There have been multiple problems with my apartment. To get management to take the issues seriously usually a parent has to become involved, even then it was a slow going process to get the problem's fixed correctly and according to code. Overall it has nice amenities  and is close to campus so it evens out to be okay in the end.

resp.text: Hi Maddy, It is unfortunate to hear of your bad experience.  We strive to continually exceed customer expectations, however, based on your experience it sounds as though we fell short.   Please feel free to contact our Customer Service Department at 512-732-1099 to discuss your Google review.

name: Jacob Locke
text: For the past two years, my experience at 160 Ross has been bliss in comparison to other apartments I've lived at.  The rent is high compared to most places in Auburn, but the amenities, accommodations, and proximity to downtown make up for the difference.  Management has always been kind and quick to respond to problems.  It is very nice to have secure garage parking!  My only complaint would be the guest parking situation.  25 guest spots is nowhere near enough parking for the ~650 residents that live here.

name: Jessica
text: Management is absolutely awful to their employees. They make their workers want to quit almost daily. Never known management to act like such teenagers. They ignore continuous complains about loud neighbors even with evidence of loud bangs and screams. They never go to the next step to get them to stop the loudness. The walls are paper thin, if you want to listen to your roommates phone call crying to their boyfriend at 3 am you’re in luck. Or the person next to you tapping their desk chair against the wall for two straight hours. And nothing is done about it. Either the people here are jerks and refuse to answer their door, or no one is sent to handle it in the first place. They will say they’ll take care of it but record absolutely nothing of the issue so each call is basically call #1 and the neighbors are never punished. Garage is a crash zone, sorority girls and guys in big trucks fly around the corner with no regards as to who may be coming. No mirrors to see around the corners. If you live here, get top floor so you can’t hear the circus above you. Not nearly enough guest parking and half of it for future residents, you WILL get towed. They lock every single door at night so there’s no way to get in, and have even taken handles off the outside of the doors.

resp.text: Hey Jessica, thank you for your review. We take your concerns very seriously and will pass along your feedback. I'm sorry that you have not had a good experience with the onsite Management resolving your noise complaints. Please give our Corporate Customer Service Team a call at 512-732-1099 to discuss your review further. We are here to help! - Rachel K. [Customer Service]

name: Miranda LaTourette
text: Living at 160 is a different kind of living experience, Its not like living on campus but it has its own way of making you feel as if you do. They always have games, events, and free food to entertain you. I love that so many of my friends live here, therefore we can go work out,goto the pool, or hangout on the green space all in the convenience of my home. Its just convenient way to socialize, live near campus, and meet new people. Although, Ive had a few issues with my living situation such as a pipe bust which caused flooding my apartment due to that and a few little things like lighting issues, management has worked well with me to address and find a solution to the problems.

name: David Marinello
text: The living room space and the Kitchen for the rooms were nice, but for the most part, that was the only nice things. The bedrooms are not large enough to warrant the price of the rent, the parking garage is a madhouse and should have been way bigger than it is, and the halls are uninviting and the layout is confusing. Also, the management is not very good and is poorly run. It is flashy, its an okay temporary place but I do not recommend living there very long.

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback and we are sorry for any frustration you may have experienced.  Please feel free to contact our Customer Service Department at 512-732-1099 to discuss your Google review.

name: lyndsey
text: If you are looking at the most relevant reviews and they are all 5 stars it is because 160 management pushes the good reviewes to the top so you will see them and sign but in reality no one wants to sign here anymore because it is the worst apartment complex in auburn. And the only good reviews on here are from a month ago and that is because they were giving out free food if you wrote a good review. If you are thinking of living here because it is close to campus and has great amenities, DO NOT LIVE HERE. 160 Ross was made fast and cheap. The walls are thin, you can hear the person above you, below you, and beside you, along with people walking in the halls. If you have a balcony, then good luck because you will hear people partying by the pool until early in the morning. and if you complain, they wont listen unless you tell them every day for a month. the doors to get in building are broken except for two. and the security guards will open the door for ANYONE. and when it is hot outside, the fire alarm will go off daily. It is now the fifth day in a row that the fire alarm has gone off in the morning. The rent amount goes up every month and i now pay 1000 a month. People throw up in the hallways and it is not cleaned up for weeks. Yes, 160 has a pool and gym but so does the Rec Center which is free for students and is way better than the pool and gym at 160. The wifi here will also randomly cut off and wont turn back on for a while. and the study rooms here are a joke! And they wont stop calling you to renew your lease after you have told the you wont renew 5 times. Also dont expect to park on the floor you live on if you get here past 7 pm and if you do park in the parking deck, be cautious because it is a CRASH ZONE! everyone drives fast and you cant see when you are turning the corner. also they forget to call pest control and roaches will appear in your freshly and weekly cleaned kitchen. walking to campus was enjoyable until construction started and now you have to walk on the street. If you call maintenance, dont except them to knock when they come. They have the key so they will walk right in, even if you are in the shower. another problem with privacy is that of you leave your blinds open, you are able to see directly into the whole room even if they are all the way across the courtyard. Also if you ever except to have guests, they will not find any parking. And the "resident activities" are always something random and scheduled in the middle of the day when everyone has class. I would have rather lived in a dorm than lived here!

resp.text: Hey Lyndsey, we greatly appreciate you as a resident and I'm sorry that you're unhappy with 160 Ross.
